head.supplied: Kempsey, ¶ July 1st 1892 ¶ My Dear Baron ¶ ¶ Herewith under Separate Cover I send you a Specimen of a noble looking tree about 80 ft by 2 ft 6 inches diameter [flinted] trunk rough light colored bar...

div.p: RB MSS M38, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; text-align: end;

div.p:
MS found with a specimen of Citronella moorei (MEL 2240569), collected by MacDonald at the McLeay River, NSW, 1892. MS annotation by M: 'Answ 7/7/92'. Letter not found. Kempsey,
NSW. July 1st 1892

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p:
Herewith under Separate Cover I send you a Specimen of a noble looking tree about 80 ft by 2 ft 6 inches diameter [flinted] trunk rough light colored bark, timber also white prettily grained resembling Maple in fact this tree by some of the old hands is called "white Maple"
Identified in the margin as: 'No 171 (White Maple)'. As the timber appears to be of value I have prepared a flitch for exhibit and will be glad if you can name from the specimen now forwarded including leaf, bud and ripe seed Anxiously looking for your reply to my last
Letter not found. giving nos 168, 169 & 170
